page.title: 09PERRANPORTH AIRFIELD
page.content: THE AIRFIELD IS SITUATED ON THE CLIFF TOPS AND DATES BACK TO THE SECOND WORLD WAR WHEN IT WAS USED AS A BASE FOR NIGHT FIGHTERS AND BOMBERS.THE SORT OF PLANES THAT USE THE AIRFIELD TODAY ARE LIGHT AIRCRAFT AND GLIDERS.THE AIRFIELD IS NOW RUN BY THE {CORNISH GLIDING CLUB.}THE AIRFIELD IS BUSIEST DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS WHEN THE UPDRAFT FROM THE CLIFFS AND THE THERMAL AIR CURRENTS ARE BEST FOR GLIDING.THERE ARE THREE SERVICEABLE RUNWAYS,THE LARGEST IS THREE QUARTERS OF A MILE LONG.THE GRASS LAND AROUND THE RUNWAYS IS USED BY LOCAL FARMERS TO GRAZE CATTLE.MANY PEOPLE PARK THEIR CARS ON THE NEARBY ROAD WHILST THEY WATCH THE GLIDERS TAKING OFF AND LANDING AT THE AIRFIELD.
